Author: vogelfreund88#4534
Content: With all the volume from digitalprice I would say around : 30-50k$ per day - that‚Äôs around 15 usd or kmd as reward from one dex per year, if all the kmd assets only traded on AtomicDEX ü§ûü§ûü§û

Author: cryptoclueless#9519
Content: @vogelfreund88 i'm trying to calculate myself.  I believe the trading fees are 0.15% of a trade.  So if AtomicDex goes crazy and has $1,000,000 of trade volume per day, thats $365,000,000 per year.  0.15% of $365,000,000 is $547,500.  DEX holders receive half of that or $$273,750.  Divide that by 1 million DEX and its about 27 cents return per DEX coin per year.  I'm not sure if that math is right, but thats what I've been thinking about on whether to buy DEX or not

Author: vogelfreund88#4534
Content: that‚Äôs a lot of time get the money back if you buy for 30,50 or 100 kmd per dex

Author: allbits#5898
Content: Originally DEX was an an asset on NXT blockchain, created in 2014. It was issued to some early backers of jl777 in the nxt community.  Then an after market developed on NXT asset exchange and many people acquired from there. It was migrated to Komodo based chain a couple of years ago.

Author: aguycalled#1820
Content: hi. where is the order book stored?

Author: SHossain#0007

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
@ca333
Is there some sort of rounding up / down for BTC amounts when creating a new order in atomicDEX, or did I find another bug? at 6 digit amounts for the base coin it rounds way too much and actually down when entering into the orderbook, so if you don't watch out you sell  much cheaper than what you set. 

At 5 digits, it's rounding up 0.002-0.003 BTC depends on what number I enter for the base coin.
At 6 digits it's rounding down 0.0015-0.002! BTC depends on what number I enter for the base coin. (I used 99999 and 555555 amounts for COMMOD, and 0.0077777 for BTC in both cases)

Can DM screenshots, let me know.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: want someone to replicate this before opening a github issue

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Someone who has 6-7digits of COMMOD please try
